t: Luke 20
Jesus’ Authority Questioned
Now*p it happened on one of those days, as He taught the people in the temple and preached the gospel, that*i the chief priests and the scribes, together with the elders, confronted Him*i
and spoke to Him, saying, “Tell us, by what authority are You doing these things? Or who is he who gave You this authority?”
But*p He answered and said to them, “I*r also*r will*r ask*r you*r one*r thing,*r and*r answer*r Me:*r
The*r baptism*r of*r John—was*r it*r from*r heaven*r or*r from*r men?”*r
And*p they reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are persuaded that John was a prophet.”
So they answered that they did not know where it*i was*i from.
And*p Jesus said to them, “Neither*r will*r I*r tell*r you*r by*r what*r authority*r I*r do*r these*r things.”*r
The Parable of the Wicked Vinedressers
Then*p He began to tell the people this parable: “A*r certain*r man*r planted*r a*r vineyard,*r leased*r it*r to*r vinedressers,*r and*r went*r into*r a*r far*r country*r for*r a*r long*r time.*r

Now*r at*r vintage-time*r he*r sent*r a*r servant*r to*r the*r vinedressers,*r that*r they*r might*r give*r him*r some*r of*r the*r fruit*r of*r the*r vineyard.*r But*r the*r vinedressers*r beat*r him*r and*r sent*r him*ir away*r empty-handed.*r
Again*r he*r sent*r another*r servant;*r and*r they*r beat*r him*r also,*r treated*r him*ir shamefully,*r and*r sent*r him*ir away*r empty-handed.*r
And*r again*r he*r sent*r a*r third;*r and*r they*r wounded*r him*r also*r and*r cast*r him*ir out.*r
“Then*p the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What*r shall*r I*r do?*r I*r will*r send*r my*r beloved*r son.*r Probably*r they*r will*r respect*r him*ir when*r they*r see*r him.’*r

But*r when*r the*r vinedressers*r saw*r him,*r they*r reasoned*r among*r themselves,*r saying,*r ‘This*r is*r the*r heir.*r Come,*r let*r us*r kill*r him,*r that*r the*r inheritance*r may*r be*r ours.’*r
So*r they*r cast*r him*r out*r of*r the*r vineyard*r and*r killed*r him.*ir Therefore*r what*r will*r the*r owner*r of*r the*r vineyard*r do*r to*r them?*r
He*r will*r come*r and*r destroy*r those*r vinedressers*r and*r give*r the*r vineyard*r to*r others.”*r And*p when they heard it*i they said, “Certainly not!”
Then*p He looked at them and said, “What*r then*r is*r this*r that*r is*r written:*r ‘The*rpn stone*r which*r the*r builders*r rejected*r Has*rld become*r the*r chief*r cornerstone’?*r
Whoever*rp falls*r on*r that*r stone*r will*r be*r broken;*r but*r on*r whomever*r it*r falls,*r it*r will*r grind*r him*r to*r powder.”*r
And*p the chief priests and the scribes that very hour sought to lay hands on Him, but they feared the people —for they knew He had spoken this parable against them.
The Pharisees: Is It Lawful to Pay Taxes to Caesar?
So*p they watched Him,*i and sent spies who pretended to be righteous, that they might seize on His words, in order to deliver Him to the power and the authority of the governor.
Then*p they asked Him, saying, “Teacher, we know that You say and teach rightly, and You do not show personal favoritism, but teach the way of God in truth:
Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
But*p He perceived their craftiness, and said to them, “Why*r do*r you*r test*r Me?*r
Show*r Me*r a*r denarius.*r Whose*r image*r and*r inscription*r does*r it*r have?”*r They*p answered and said, “Caesar’s.”
And*p He said to them, “Render*r therefore*r to*r Caesar*r the*r things*r that*r are*r Caesar’s,*r and*r to*r God*r the*r things*r that*r are*r God’s.”*r
But*p they could not catch Him in His words in the presence of the people. And they marveled at His answer and kept silent.
The Sadducees: What About the Resurrection?
Then*p some of the Sadducees, who deny that there is a resurrection, came to Him*i and asked Him,
saying: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us that*i if a man’s brother dies, having a wife, and he dies without children, his brother should take his wife and raise up offspring for his brother.
Now there were seven brothers. And the first took a wife, and died without children.
And the second took her as wife, and he died childless.
Then the third took her, and in like manner the seven also; and they left no children, and died.
Last of all the woman died also.
Therefore, in the resurrection, whose wife does she become? For all seven had her as wife.”
Jesus*p answered and said to them, “The*r sons*r of*r this*r age*r marry*r and*r are*r given*r in*r marriage.*r
But*r those*r who*r are*r counted*r worthy*r to*r attain*r that*r age,*r and*r the*r resurrection*r from*r the*r dead,*r neither*r marry*r nor*r are*r given*r in*r marriage;*r
nor*r can*r they*r die*r anymore,*r for*r they*r are*r equal*r to*r the*r angels*r and*r are*r sons*r of*r God,*r being*r sons*r of*r the*r resurrection.*r

But*r even*r Moses*r showed*r in*r the*r burning*ir bush*r passage*ir that*r the*r dead*r are*r raised,*r when*r he*r called*r the*r Lord*r ‘the*r God*r of*r Abraham,*r the*r God*r of*r Isaac,*r and*r the*r God*r of*r Jacob.’*r
For*r He*r is*r not*r the*r God*r of*r the*r dead*r but*r of*r the*r living,*r for*r all*r live*r to*r Him.”*r
Then*p some of the scribes answered and said, “Teacher, You have spoken well.”
But after that they dared not question Him anymore.
Jesus: How Can David Call His Descendant Lord?
And*p He said to them, “How*r can*r they*r say*r that*r the*r Christ*r is*r the*r Son*r of*r David?*r
Now*r David*r himself*r said*r in*r the*r Book*r of*r Psalms:*r ‘The*rpn Lord*sb said*r to*r my*r Lord,*r “Sit*rld at*r My*r right*r hand,*r
Till*rld I*r make*r Your*r enemies*r Your*r footstool.”’*r
Therefore*rp David*r calls*r Him*r ‘Lord’;*r how*r is*r He*r then*r his*r Son?”*r
Beware of the Scribes
Then,*p in the hearing of all the people, He said to His disciples,

“Beware*r of*r the*r scribes,*r who*r desire*r to*r go*r around*r in*r long*r robes,*r love*r greetings*r in*r the*r marketplaces,*r the*r best*r seats*r in*r the*r synagogues,*r and*r the*r best*r places*r at*r feasts,*r
who*r devour*r widows’*r houses,*r and*r for*r a*r pretense*r make*r long*r prayers.*r These*r will*r receive*r greater*r condemnation.”*r
